alert.note: Alert for Northern Clearwater Mountains; Southern Clearwater Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 06 at 1:27PM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches for valleys. 3 to 6 inches for Lolo Pass and higher benches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations for valleys of 8 to 16 inches. 16 to 24 inches possible for Lolo Pass, with 2 to 3 feet possible in the highest terrain. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph causing blowing and drifting snow in the terrain and over mountain passes. * WHERE...Dixie, Elk River, Elk City, Pierce, Highway 12 Lowell to Lolo Pass, and Highway 11 Pierce to Headquarters. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 PM this afternoon to 10 AM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible Monday night into Wednesday morning. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Travel could be affected.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Northern Clearwater Mountains; Southern Clearwater Mountains
